protocol.name: P-GSE29771-2
protocol.text: Leaves were harvested at 14 days after placing on growth conditions and ground on liquid nitrogen.

protocol.name: P-GSE29771-3
protocol.text: All plants were grown under 16-h-light (22°C)/8-h-dark (20°C) cycles, either grown on soil or on plates with MS media containing 1.5% sucrose and 0.8% agar with appropriate selection markers. All seeds were vernalized at 4oC for 3 days before placement in a growth environment.

protocol.name: P-GSE29771-4
protocol.text: Total RNA was isolated in three biological replicates from leaves of two-week-old wild type (ProβCG:GUS) and two biological replicates from mutants (essp4/sdg8-5, sdg8-2) seedlings grown on MS agar plates (1.5% sucrose) using the RNeasy Plant Mini Kit (QIAGEN).

protocol.name: P-GSE29771-5
text: Labelling, hybridization, and detection were performed in McGill University and Genome Quebec Innovation Centre (

protocol.name: P-GSE29771-7

protocol.name: P-GSE29771-8
protocol.text: MAS 5.0 raw data were generated by FLEXARRAY provided by McGill University and Genome Quebec Innovation Centre. The raw MAS 5.0 data files obtained from scanned array images are then imported into GeneSpring 7.3.1 (Silicon Genetics). Only genes with Present (P) calls were included in the analysis. Raw signals of each gene were normalized with the median of all measurements on the chip. The average normalized value of the signal intensity for each gene in three replicate hybridization experiments was adopted as the expression value of the gene. The normalized values were used to identify the differentially regulated genes by calculating the log2 ratios, where the normalized mean intensity values of sdg8 were divided by respective values from ProβCG:GUS. Fold changes of differentially regulated genes in sdg8 compared with ProβCG:GUS were calculated from these ratios.For multiple comparisons among slides, a false discovery rate (FDR) multiple testing correction (Benjamini and Hochberg, 1995) was applied to generate adjusted p-values in GeneSpring 7.3.1 Using a FDR at 5% (p-value=0.05), we selected only the statistically significant genes that were regarded as differentially regulated only if their fold-change was ≥ 2.0 for up- and ≤ -2.0 fold for downregulated.
